title: Microlearning for Organizational Leadership and Civic Competency Enhancement Utilizing the Pygmalion Effect

context.prior_knowledge: Basic leadership concepts, organizational communication experience, foundational understanding of sociopsychological effects (e.g., Pygmalion effect), and awareness of civic consciousness and social responsibility
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive course aiming to improve trainers' behaviors and learners' self-esteem in smartphone-based learning environments. Includes social interaction strategies (e.g., collaborative problem-solving, fostering community consciousness) for organizational culture improvement and civic capacity building.

learning_goals: Understand the Pygmalion effect and apply it to organizational learning design to promote civic consciousness and positive relationship-building.

As trainers, learners can use three or more positive expectation communication techniques (e.g., specific praise, future-oriented feedback, nonverbal encouragement) and receive an "Effective Communication" evaluation from at least one of two peer evaluators in a role-play assessment.
Apply feedback techniques that strengthen learners' self-esteem and civic consciousness in real work contexts, fostering social responsibility.
Achieve over 80% participation in microlearning content within one week, enhancing learning culture and social interaction strategies within the organization.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
